comment_regular_data.body: It seems that gen_vimdoc.py doesn't generate docs for highlight.lua. I'll take a look later.
Tweaked gen_vimdoc.py to generate the docs for vim.hightlight. Please have a look.

Could you reorder the sections so that they're alphabetical again? And the docs for  `on_yank()` are a bit too terse now; it doesn't have to be quite as verbose as my old text, but it should be complete sentences...

(While you're at it, you could convert the examples to Lua using `vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd`.)

> And the docs for `on_yank()` are a bit too terse now; it doesn't have to be quite as verbose as my old text, but it should be complete sentences...
> 
> (While you're at it, you could convert the examples to Lua using `vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd`.)

done



> Could you reorder the sections so that they're alphabetical again?

If you mean `section_order` in gen_vimdoc.py, the sections were not in alphabetical order in the first place

I'll defer to @lewis6991 here, but this is touching a few areas that are under heavy development right now, and I'd prefer _those_ PRs not to be saddled with a merge conflict (I'm looking at you, LSP semantic tokens...)

So if you're OK with this, I'd prefer to park this until the big PRs are in to make sure we don't regress anything, and then merge this (after a rebase/final sweep) for the 0.9 feature freeze? (This is definitely a very welcome contribution, so don't worry about this being left behind!)
Yes, that makes sense to me. In the future it would be best to limit the size of PR's.

It would at least help to split the PR into (self-contained) commits focusing on a single "subsystem" like LSP, treesitter, core... Then we could split out and merge those that do not conflict with ongoing work.

(As @lewis6991 said, smaller is better for PRs; it's enough to mention in the PR description that this is part of a larger effort.)

> I'll defer to @lewis6991 here, but this is touching a few areas that are under heavy development right now, and I'd prefer _those_ PRs not to be saddled with a merge conflict (I'm looking at you, LSP semantic tokens...)

Makes sense. Then what about just merging the commits excluding the last one (number -> integer)?

If you squash them down and drop the last one from this PR (and open a new one with it, either now or later), sure. You can also separate the last commit into smaller ones, some of which could be merged now (treesitter and core, for example).

I'd like to merge these two commits without squashing in this PR:
* docs(highlight): use gen_vimdoc for vim.highlight
* docs(highlight): fix type annotations

I'll make a separate PR for this commit
* docs(lsp): type annotation for lsp.client

Finally, I'll break this commit into smaller commits involving a single component, and make PRs separately.
* docs: number  integer

> Also, might make sense to wait for https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/22498?

oh that looks good. I'll defer "docs(highlight): use gen_vimdoc for vim.highlight" to another PR and leave only "docs(highlight): fix type annotations" for this PR.
